page.title: 02The History of Our Area.
page.content: The Industrial Revolution, with its need for iron and coal brought Cinderford into being. Iron mining had carried on from pre-Roman times, but in the Middle Ages the Forest of Dean was reserved for royal hunting. Only the villages on the outskirts are early in origin, with Littledean being a much older place. By the mid nineteenth century deep coal mines were made possible by the introduction of pumping engines. {Cinderford grew up from clusters of {cottages of the foundrymen and miners. {In the 1960's the last of the deep {mines were closed, but Cinderford's {past is reflected in such buildings as {the Miners Hall, College, (originally {a mining college,) and the Council {Offices which were colliery owners' {houses. By Miss Drewett (Head, Bilson School)
